001package io.jstach.rainbowgum;
002
003import java.io.IOException;
004import java.io.UncheckedIOException;
005import java.lang.StackWalker.StackFrame;
006import java.lang.System.Logger.Level;
007import java.time.Instant;
008import java.util.ArrayList;
009import java.util.List;
010import java.util.function.Supplier;
011
012import org.eclipse.jdt.annotation.Nullable;
013
014import io.jstach.rainbowgum.KeyValues.MutableKeyValues;
015import io.jstach.rainbowgum.LogEvent.Builder;
016import io.jstach.rainbowgum.LogEvent.Caller;
017import io.jstach.rainbowgum.LogRouter.Router;
018
019/**
020 * A LogEvent is a container for a single call to a logger. An event should not be created
021 * unless a route or logger is actually enabled.
022 *
023 * @author agentgt
024 * @apiNote LogEvent is currently sealed. The reason there are so many static creation
025 * methods is for optimization purposes because other than actual outputting creating
026 * events is generally the most expensive operation (mostly in terms of memory) a logging
027 * system does.
028 * @see LogMessageFormatter
029 */
030public sealed interface LogEvent {
031
032        /**
033         * Creates a log event.
034         * @param level the logging level.
035         * @param loggerName the name of the logger which is usually a class name.
036         * @param formattedMessage the unformatted message.
037         * @param keyValues key values that come from MDC or an SLF4J Event Builder.
038         * @param throwable an exception if passed maybe <code>null</code>.
039         * @return event
040         * @see LevelResolver
041         * @apiNote the message is already assumed to be formatted as no arguments are passed.
042         */
043        public static LogEvent of(System.Logger.Level level, String loggerName, String formattedMessage,
044                        KeyValues keyValues, @Nullable Throwable throwable) {
045                Instant timeStamp = Instant.now();
046                Thread currentThread = Thread.currentThread();
047                String threadName = currentThread.getName();
048                long threadId = currentThread.threadId();
049
050                return new DefaultLogEvent(timeStamp, threadName, threadId, level, loggerName, formattedMessage, keyValues,
051                                throwable);
052
053        }
054
055        /**
056         * Creates a log event.
057         * @param level the logging level.
058         * @param loggerName the name of the logger which is usually a class name.
059         * @param formattedMessage the unformatted message.
060         * @param throwable an exception if passed maybe <code>null</code>.
061         * @return event
062         * @see LevelResolver
063         * @apiNote the message is already assumed to be formatted as no arguments are passed.
064         */
065        static LogEvent of(System.Logger.Level level, String loggerName, String formattedMessage,
066                        @Nullable Throwable throwable) {
067                return of(level, loggerName, formattedMessage, KeyValues.of(), throwable);
068        }
069
070        /**
071         * Creates a log event.
072         * @param level the logging level.
073         * @param loggerName the name of the logger which is usually a class name.
074         * @param message the unformatted message.
075         * @param keyValues key values that come from MDC or an SLF4J Event Builder.
076         * @param messageFormatter formatter to use for rendering a message when
077         * #{@link LogEvent#formattedMessage(StringBuilder)} is called.
078         * @param arg1 argument that will be passed to messageFormatter.
079         * @return event
080         * @see LevelResolver
081         * @see LogMessageFormatter
082         */
083        public static LogEvent of(System.Logger.Level level, String loggerName, String message, KeyValues keyValues,
084                        LogMessageFormatter messageFormatter, @Nullable Object arg1) {
085                Instant timeStamp = Instant.now();
086                Thread currentThread = Thread.currentThread();
087                String threadName = currentThread.getName();
088                long threadId = currentThread.threadId();
089                return new OneArgLogEvent(timeStamp, threadName, threadId, level, loggerName, message, keyValues,
090                                messageFormatter, null, arg1);
091        }
092
093        /**
094         * Creates a log event.
095         * @param level the logging level.
096         * @param loggerName the name of the logger which is usually a class name.
097         * @param message the unformatted message.
098         * @param keyValues key values that come from MDC or an SLF4J Event Builder.
099         * @param messageFormatter formatter to use for rendering a message when
100         * #{@link LogEvent#formattedMessage(StringBuilder)} is called.
101         * @param arg1 argument that will be passed to messageFormatter.
102         * @param arg2 argument that will be passed to messageFormatter.
103         * @return event
104         * @see LevelResolver
105         * @see LogMessageFormatter
106         */
107        public static LogEvent of(System.Logger.Level level, String loggerName, String message, KeyValues keyValues,
108                        LogMessageFormatter messageFormatter, @Nullable Object arg1, @Nullable Object arg2) {
109                Instant timeStamp = Instant.now();
110                Thread currentThread = Thread.currentThread();
111                String threadName = currentThread.getName();
112                long threadId = currentThread.threadId();
113                return new TwoArgLogEvent(timeStamp, threadName, threadId, level, loggerName, message, keyValues,
114                                messageFormatter, null, arg1, arg2);
115        }
116
117        /**
118         * Creates a log event.
119         * @param level the logging level.
120         * @param loggerName the name of the logger which is usually a class name.
121         * @param message the unformatted message.
122         * @param keyValues key values that come from MDC or an SLF4J Event Builder.
123         * @param messageFormatter formatter to use for rendering a message when
124         * #{@link LogEvent#formattedMessage(StringBuilder)} is called.
125         * @param args an array of arguments that will be passed to messageFormatter. The
126         * contents maybe null elements but the array itself should not be null.
127         * @return event
128         * @see LevelResolver
129         * @see LogMessageFormatter
130         */
131        public static LogEvent ofArgs(System.Logger.Level level, String loggerName, String message, KeyValues keyValues,
132                        LogMessageFormatter messageFormatter, @Nullable Object[] args) {
133                Instant timeStamp = Instant.now();
134                Thread currentThread = Thread.currentThread();
135                String threadName = currentThread.getName();
136                long threadId = currentThread.threadId();
137                return new ArrayArgLogEvent(timeStamp, threadName, threadId, level, loggerName, message, keyValues,
138                                messageFormatter, null, args);
139        }
140
141        /**
142         * Creates a log event with everything specified.
143         * @param timestamp time of event
144         * @param threadName or empty string
145         * @param threadId thread id or 0 if that cannot be resolved.
146         * @param level the logging level.
147         * @param loggerName the name of the logger which is usually a class name.
148         * @param message the unformatted message.
149         * @param keyValues key values that come from MDC or an SLF4J Event Builder.
150         * @param throwable or <code>null</code>.
151         * @param messageFormatter formatter to use for rendering a message when
152         * #{@link LogEvent#formattedMessage(StringBuilder)} is called.
153         * @param args an array of arguments that will be passed to messageFormatter. The
154         * contents maybe null elements but the array itself should not be null.
155         * @return event
156         * @see LevelResolver
157         * @see LogMessageFormatter
158         */
159        public static LogEvent ofAll(Instant timestamp, String threadName, long threadId, System.Logger.Level level,
160                        String loggerName, String message, KeyValues keyValues, @Nullable Throwable throwable,
161                        LogMessageFormatter messageFormatter, @SuppressWarnings("exports") @Nullable List<@Nullable Object> args) {
162
163                if (args == null) {
164                        return new DefaultLogEvent(timestamp, threadName, threadId, level, loggerName, message, keyValues,
165                                        throwable);
166                }
167                int size = args.size();
168                return switch (size) {
169                        case 0 ->
170                                new DefaultLogEvent(timestamp, threadName, threadId, level, loggerName, message, keyValues, throwable);
171                        case 1 -> new OneArgLogEvent(timestamp, threadName, threadId, level, loggerName, message, keyValues,
172                                        messageFormatter, throwable, args.get(0));
173                        case 2 -> new TwoArgLogEvent(timestamp, threadName, threadId, level, loggerName, message, keyValues,
174                                        messageFormatter, throwable, args.get(0), args.get(1));
175                        default -> new ArrayArgLogEvent(timestamp, threadName, threadId, level, loggerName, message, keyValues,
176                                        messageFormatter, throwable, args.toArray());
177                };
178        }
179
180        /**
181         * Creates a new event with the caller info attached. <em> This method always returns
182         * a new event does not check if the original has caller info. </em>
183         * @param event original event.
184         * @param caller caller info.
185         * @return new log event.
186         */
187        public static LogEvent withCaller(LogEvent event, Caller caller) {
188                return new StackFrameLogEvent(event, caller);
189        }
190
191        /**
192         * Timestamp when the event was created.
193         * @return instant when the event was created.
194         */
195        public Instant timestamp();
196
197        /**
198         * Name of the thread.
199         * @return thread name.
200         * @apiNote this maybe empty and often is if virtual threads are used.
201         */
202        public String threadName();
203
204        /**
205         * Thread id.
206         * @return thread id.
207         */
208        public long threadId();
209
210        /**
211         * The logging level. {@linkplain java.lang.System.Logger.Level#ALL} and
212         * {@linkplain java.lang.System.Logger.Level#OFF} should not be returned as they have
213         * special meaning.
214         * @return level.
215         */
216        public System.Logger.Level level();
217
218        /**
219         * Name of logger.
220         * @return name of logger.
221         */
222        public String loggerName();
223
224        /**
225         * Unformatted message.
226         * @return unformatted message
227         * @see #formattedMessage(StringBuilder)
228         */
229        public String message();
230
231        /**
232         * Appends the formatted message.
233         * @param sb string builder to use.
234         * @see LogMessageFormatter
235         */
236        public void formattedMessage(StringBuilder sb);
237
238        /**
239         * Appends the formatted message.
240         * @param a appendable to append to.
241         * @see LogMessageFormatter
242         * @throws UncheckedIOException if an IOException is thrown by the appendable.
243         */
244        default void formattedMessage(Appendable a) {
245                StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder();
246                formattedMessage(sb);
247                try {
248                        a.append(sb);
249                }
250                catch (IOException e) {
251                        throw new UncheckedIOException(e);
252                }
253        }
254
255        /**
256         * Throwable at the time of the event passed from the logger.
257         * @return if the event does not have a throwable <code>null</code> will be returned.
258         */
259        public @Nullable Throwable throwableOrNull();
260
261        /**
262         * Key values that usually come from MDC or an SLF4J Event Builder.
263         * @return key values.
264         */
265        public KeyValues keyValues();
266
267        /**
268         * Returns info about caller or <code>null</code> if not supported.
269         * @return caller info
270         */
271        default @Nullable Caller callerOrNull() {
272                return null;
273        }
274
275        /**
276         * Freeze will return a LogEvent that is safe to use in a different thread. Usually
277         * this entails copying the data or checking if it is already immutable. Freeze should
278         * be called before passing an event to an {@link LogPublisher.AsyncLogPublisher}.
279         * @return thread safe log event.
280         */
281        public LogEvent freeze();
282
283        /**
284         * Freeze and replace with the given timestamp.
285         * @param timestamp instant to replace timestamp in this.
286         * @return a copy of this with the given timestamp.
287         */
288        public LogEvent freeze(Instant timestamp);
289
290        /**
291         * A builder to create events by calling {@link Router#eventBuilder(String, Level)}.
292         * <strong>{@link #log()}</strong> should be called at the very end otherwise the
293         * event will not be logged. <strong> Because of potential future optimizations (see
294         * API note) It is best to assume this builder returns a different builder on every
295         * setter call even if it may not currently! </strong>
296         *
297         * @apiNote unless the builder gets marked for escape analysis the static
298         * {@link LogEvent} factory methods are more likely to be superior in performance. EA
299         * is tricky business and often requires the object be small enough and should not
300         * leave the method it is constructed in but the JDK is continuously getting better
301         * optimizing immutable objects. Thus it is best to assume this builder will return a
302         * different builder on every call.
303         */
304        public sealed interface Builder {
305
306                /**
307                 * Timestamp when the event was created.
308                 * @param timestamp time the event happened.
309                 * @return this.
310                 */
311                public Builder timestamp(Instant timestamp);
312
313                /**
314                 * Add an argument to the event being built.
315                 * @param argSupplier supplier will be called immediately if this event is to be
316                 * logged.
317                 * @return this.
318                 */
319                Builder arg(Supplier<?> argSupplier);
320
321                /**
322                 * Add an argument to the event being built.
323                 * @param arg maybe null.
324                 * @return this.
325                 */
326                Builder arg(@Nullable Object arg);
327
328                /**
329                 * Sets the message formatter which interpolates argument place holders.
330                 * @param messageFormatter formatter if not set
331                 * {@link LogMessageFormatter.StandardMessageFormatter#SLF4J} will be used.
332                 * @return this.
333                 */
334                public Builder messageFormatter(LogMessageFormatter messageFormatter);
335
336                /**
337                 * Name of the thread.
338                 * @param threadName name of thread.
339                 * @return this.
340                 * @apiNote this maybe empty and often is if virtual threads are used.
341                 */
342                public Builder threadName(String threadName);
343
344                /**
345                 * Thread id.
346                 * @param threadId {@link Thread#getId()}.
347                 * @return this.
348                 */
349                public Builder threadId(long threadId);
350
351                /**
352                 * Unformatted message.
353                 * @param message unformatted message.
354                 * @return unformatted message
355                 */
356                public Builder message(String message);
357
358                /**
359                 * Throwable at the time of the event passed from the logger.
360                 * @param throwable exception at the time of the event.
361                 * @return if the event does not have a throwable <code>null</code> will be
362                 * returned.
363                 */
364                public Builder throwable(@Nullable Throwable throwable);
365
366                /**
367                 * Key values that usually come from MDC or an SLF4J Event Builder.
368                 * @param keyValues will use the passed in key values for the event.
369                 * @return key values.
370                 */
371                public Builder keyValues(KeyValues keyValues);
372
373                /**
374                 * Will log the event with the current values.
375                 * @return true if accepted.
376                 */
377                public boolean log();
378
379                /**
380                 * Will generate the event if the router can accept otherwise <code>null</code>.
381                 * @return event or <code>null</code>.
382                 * @apiNote The event is not logged but just created if possible if logging is
383                 * desired use {@link #log()} or check if the return is not <code>null</code> and
384                 * then log.
385                 */
386                public @Nullable LogEvent eventOrNull();
387
388        }
389
390        /**
391         * Caller info usually derived from Stack walking.
392         */
393        public sealed interface Caller {
394
395                /**
396                 * Creates caller info from a stack frame.
397                 * @param stackFrame stack frame must have
398                 * {@link java.lang.StackWalker.Option#RETAIN_CLASS_REFERENCE}.
399                 * @return caller info.
400                 */
401                public static Caller of(StackFrame stackFrame) {
402                        return new StackFrameCallerInfo(stackFrame);
403                }
404
405                /**
406                 * See {@link StackFrame#getClassName()}.
407                 * @return class name.
408                 */
409                public String className();
410
411                /**
412                 * See {@link StackFrame#getFileName()}.
413                 * @return file name.
414                 */
415                public @Nullable String fileNameOrNull();
416
417                /**
418                 * See {@link StackFrame#getLineNumber()}.
419                 * @return line number.
420                 */
421                public int lineNumber();
422
423                /**
424                 * See {@link StackFrame#getMethodName()}.
425                 * @return method name.
426                 */
427                public String methodName();
428
429                /**
430                 * Make the caller info immutable.
431                 * @return immutable caller info and if this is already immutable return this.
432                 */
433                public Caller freeze();
434
435        }
436
437}
438
439record FrozenCallerInfo(String className, @Nullable String fileNameOrNull, int lineNumber,
440                String methodName) implements LogEvent.Caller {
441        @Override
442        public Caller freeze() {
443                return this;
444        }
445}
446
447record StackFrameCallerInfo(StackFrame stackFrame) implements LogEvent.Caller {
448
449        @Override
450        public String className() {
451                return stackFrame.getClassName();
452        }
453
454        @Override
455        public @Nullable String fileNameOrNull() {
456                /*
457                 * TODO checker did not know file name is null.
458                 */
459                return stackFrame.getFileName();
460        }
461
462        @Override
463        public int lineNumber() {
464                return stackFrame.getLineNumber();
465        }
466
467        @Override
468        public String methodName() {
469                return stackFrame.getMethodName();
470        }
471
472        @Override
473        public Caller freeze() {
474                return new FrozenCallerInfo(className(), fileNameOrNull(), lineNumber(), methodName());
475        }
476
477}
478
479final class LogEventBuilder implements LogEvent.Builder {
480
481        private final LogEventLogger logger;
482
483        private final Level level;
484
485        private final String loggerName;
486
487        private Instant timestamp = Instant.now();
488
489        private String threadName = Thread.currentThread().getName();
490
491        private long threadId = Thread.currentThread().threadId();
492
493        private String message = "";
494
495        private @Nullable Throwable throwable;
496
497        private KeyValues keyValues = KeyValues.of();
498
499        private @Nullable List<@Nullable Object> args = null;
500
501        private LogMessageFormatter messageFormatter = LogMessageFormatter.StandardMessageFormatter.SLF4J;
502
503        LogEventBuilder(LogEventLogger logger, Level level, String loggerName) {
504                super();
505                this.logger = logger;
506                this.level = level;
507                this.loggerName = loggerName;
508        }
509
510        @Override
511        public Builder timestamp(Instant timestamp) {
512                this.timestamp = timestamp;
513                return this;
514        }
515
516        @Override
517        public Builder threadName(String threadName) {
518                this.threadName = threadName;
519                return this;
520        }
521
522        @Override
523        public Builder threadId(long threadId) {
524                this.threadId = threadId;
525                return this;
526        }
527
528        @Override
529        public Builder message(String message) {
530                this.message = message;
531                return this;
532        }
533
534        @Override
535        public Builder messageFormatter(LogMessageFormatter messageFormatter) {
536                this.messageFormatter = messageFormatter;
537                return this;
538        }
539
540        @Override
541        public Builder throwable(@Nullable Throwable throwable) {
542                this.throwable = throwable;
543                return this;
544        }
545
546        @Override
547        public Builder keyValues(KeyValues keyValues) {
548                this.keyValues = keyValues;
549                return this;
550        }
551
552        @Override
553        public Builder arg(@Nullable Object arg) {
554                var list = this.args;
555                if (list == null) {
556                        list = this.args = new ArrayList<>();
557                }
558                list.add(arg);
559                return this;
560        }
561
562        @Override
563        public Builder arg(Supplier<?> argSupplier) {
564                return arg(argSupplier.get());
565        }
566
567        @Override
568        public boolean log() {
569                var event = eventOrNull();
570                logger.log(event);
571                return true;
572        }
573
574        @Override
575        public LogEvent eventOrNull() {
576                return LogEvent.ofAll(timestamp, threadName, threadId, level, loggerName, message, keyValues, throwable,
577                                messageFormatter, this.args);
578        }
579
580}
581
582enum NoOpLogEventBuilder implements LogEvent.Builder {
583
584        NOOP;
585
586        @Override
587        public Builder timestamp(Instant timestamp) {
588                return this;
589        }
590
591        @Override
592        public Builder threadName(String threadName) {
593                return this;
594        }
595
596        @Override
597        public Builder threadId(long threadId) {
598                return this;
599        }
600
601        @Override
602        public Builder message(String message) {
603                return this;
604        }
605
606        @Override
607        public Builder throwable(@Nullable Throwable throwable) {
608                return this;
609        }
610
611        @Override
612        public Builder keyValues(KeyValues keyValues) {
613                return this;
614        }
615
616        @Override
617        public Builder messageFormatter(LogMessageFormatter messageFormatter) {
618                return this;
619        }
620
621        @Override
622        public boolean log() {
623                return false;
624        }
625
626        @Override
627        public @Nullable LogEvent eventOrNull() {
628                return null;
629        }
630
631        @Override
632        public Builder arg(Supplier<?> argSupplier) {
633                return this;
634        }
635
636        @Override
637        public Builder arg(@Nullable Object arg) {
638                return this;
639        }
640
641}
642
643enum EmptyLogEvent implements LogEvent {
644
645        INFO() {
646                @Override
647                public Level level() {
648                        return Level.INFO;
649                }
650        },
651        DEBUG() {
652                @Override
653                public Level level() {
654                        return Level.DEBUG;
655                }
656        };
657
658        @Override
659        public Instant timestamp() {
660                return Instant.EPOCH;
661        }
662
663        @Override
664        public String threadName() {
665                return "";
666        }
667
668        @Override
669        public long threadId() {
670                return 0;
671        }
672
673        @Override
674        public String loggerName() {
675                return "";
676        }
677
678        @Override
679        public String message() {
680                return "";
681        }
682
683        @Override
684        public void formattedMessage(StringBuilder sb) {
685
686        }
687
688        @Override
689        public @Nullable Throwable throwableOrNull() {
690                return null;
691        }
692
693        @Override
694        public KeyValues keyValues() {
695                return KeyValues.of();
696        }
697
698        public int argCount() {
699                return 0;
700        }
701
702        @Override
703        public LogEvent freeze() {
704                return this;
705        }
706
707        @Override
708        public LogEvent freeze(Instant timestamp) {
709                return this;
710        }
711
712}
713
714record OneArgLogEvent(Instant timestamp, String threadName, long threadId, System.Logger.Level level, String loggerName,
715                String message, KeyValues keyValues, LogMessageFormatter messageFormatter, @Nullable Throwable throwableOrNull,
716                @Nullable Object arg1) implements LogEvent {
717
718        @Override
719        public void formattedMessage(StringBuilder sb) {
720                messageFormatter.format(sb, message, arg1);
721        }
722
723        public int argCount() {
724                return 1;
725        }
726
727        @Override
728        public LogEvent freeze() {
729                return freeze(timestamp);
730        }
731
732        @Override
733        public LogEvent freeze(Instant timestamp) {
734                StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder(message.length());
735                formattedMessage(sb);
736                return new DefaultLogEvent(timestamp, threadName, threadId, level, loggerName, sb.toString(),
737                                keyValues.freeze(), throwableOrNull);
738        }
739
740}
741
742record TwoArgLogEvent(Instant timestamp, String threadName, long threadId, System.Logger.Level level, String loggerName,
743                String message, KeyValues keyValues, LogMessageFormatter messageFormatter, @Nullable Throwable throwableOrNull,
744                @Nullable Object arg1, @Nullable Object arg2) implements LogEvent {
745
746        @Override
747        public void formattedMessage(StringBuilder sb) {
748                messageFormatter.format(sb, message, arg1, arg2);
749        }
750
751        public int argCount() {
752                return 2;
753        }
754
755        @Override
756        public LogEvent freeze() {
757                return freeze(timestamp);
758        }
759
760        @Override
761        public LogEvent freeze(Instant timestamp) {
762                StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder(message.length());
763                formattedMessage(sb);
764                return new DefaultLogEvent(timestamp, threadName, threadId, level, loggerName, sb.toString(),
765                                keyValues.freeze(), throwableOrNull);
766        }
767}
768
769record ArrayArgLogEvent(Instant timestamp, String threadName, long threadId, System.Logger.Level level,
770                String loggerName, String message, KeyValues keyValues, LogMessageFormatter messageFormatter,
771                @Nullable Throwable throwableOrNull, @Nullable Object[] args) implements LogEvent {
772
773        @Override
774        public void formattedMessage(StringBuilder sb) {
775                messageFormatter.formatArray(sb, message, args);
776        }
777
778        public int argCount() {
779                return args.length;
780        }
781
782        @Override
783        public LogEvent freeze() {
784                return freeze(timestamp);
785        }
786
787        @Override
788        public LogEvent freeze(Instant timestamp) {
789                StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder(message.length());
790                formattedMessage(sb);
791                return new DefaultLogEvent(timestamp, threadName, threadId, level, loggerName, sb.toString(),
792                                keyValues.freeze(), throwableOrNull);
793        }
794
795}
796
797record DefaultLogEvent(Instant timestamp, String threadName, long threadId, System.Logger.Level level,
798                String loggerName, String formattedMessage, KeyValues keyValues,
799                @Nullable Throwable throwableOrNull) implements LogEvent {
800
801        public int argCount() {
802                return 0;
803        }
804
805        public KeyValues getKeyValues() {
806                return keyValues;
807        }
808
809        @Override
810        public void formattedMessage(StringBuilder sb) {
811                sb.append(this.formattedMessage);
812        }
813
814        @Override
815        public String message() {
816                return this.formattedMessage;
817        }
818
819        @Override
820        public LogEvent freeze() {
821                if (keyValues instanceof MutableKeyValues mkvs) {
822                        return new DefaultLogEvent(timestamp, threadName, threadId, level, loggerName, formattedMessage,
823                                        mkvs.freeze(), throwableOrNull);
824                }
825                return this;
826        }
827
828        @Override
829        public LogEvent freeze(Instant timestamp) {
830                if (keyValues instanceof MutableKeyValues mkvs) {
831                        return new DefaultLogEvent(timestamp, threadName, threadId, level, loggerName, formattedMessage,
832                                        mkvs.freeze(), throwableOrNull);
833                }
834                return new DefaultLogEvent(timestamp, threadName, threadId, level, loggerName, formattedMessage, keyValues,
835                                throwableOrNull);
836        }
837
838}
839
840record StackFrameLogEvent(LogEvent event, Caller callerOrNull) implements LogEvent {
841
842        @Override
843        public Instant timestamp() {
844                return event.timestamp();
845        }
846
847        @Override
848        public String threadName() {
849                return event.threadName();
850        }
851
852        @Override
853        public long threadId() {
854                return event.threadId();
855        }
856
857        @Override
858        public Level level() {
859                return event.level();
860        }
861
862        @Override
863        public String loggerName() {
864                return event.loggerName();
865        }
866
867        @Override
868        public String message() {
869                return event.message();
870        }
871
872        @Override
873        public void formattedMessage(StringBuilder sb) {
874                event.formattedMessage(sb);
875
876        }
877
878        @Override
879        public @Nullable Throwable throwableOrNull() {
880                return event.throwableOrNull();
881        }
882
883        @Override
884        public KeyValues keyValues() {
885                return event.keyValues();
886        }
887
888        @Override
889        public LogEvent freeze() {
890                var e = event.freeze();
891                var info = callerOrNull.freeze();
892                if (e == event && info == callerOrNull) {
893                        return this;
894                }
895
896                return new StackFrameLogEvent(e, info);
897        }
898
899        @Override
900        public LogEvent freeze(Instant timestamp) {
901                var e = event.freeze(timestamp);
902                var info = callerOrNull.freeze();
903                if (e == event && info == callerOrNull) {
904                        return this;
905                }
906                return new StackFrameLogEvent(e, info);
907        }
908
909}
